rm:article.author: Megan Kirkwood
rm:article.title: Mad About Ms. Jones
rm:article.rm:body:
Of all the leading ladies that survived the rained-out red-carpet at this year's Golden Globes, our pick of the night was small screen head-turner, January Jones.Â  Yes, she just so happens to star on one of our fave television shows, Mad Men, but January brings her A-game to the carpet and, in our humble opinion, steals the spotlight from playing-it-safe A-listers (remember last year's sky coloured Versace and tangerine pout?). Sunday night, we were loving her fresh, no-fuss skin, scarlet lips and nails, and--above all--her unconventional hair band (which probably helped her locks stay put during the washed-out arrivals). All paired with her chic, jet-hued Lanvin? We're smitten, Mrs. Draper.

January Jones

rm:article.author: Mosha Lundstrom Halbert
rm:article.title: High Notes
rm:article.rm:body:
Opera singer Measha Brueggergosman radiated Olympic spirit at the Opening Ceremonies on Friday, February 13th in Vancouver. The trick to her sparkle? Major Canadian rocks--think over $66 000 worth of jewels by Toronto-based designer Myles Mindham's Measha Collection. The medley of precious metals and gemstones set off her golden gown by DSquared2. This Canadian diva's stellar style was worthy of the world stage. For more on the Measha Collection, visit www.mindham.com

Measha with Dean and Dan Caten of DSquared2

The Measha Collection by Myles Mindham
rm:article.rm:desc: Measha Brueggergosman goes for fashion gold
